replies.bodyText: I don't think it will work because, the function I have used is generateXpathQuery(ast). This function uses a number of other methods from the class XpathQueryGenerator. It might happen that those method use the other member variables from the existing constructor.
replies.author: developerhb

replies.bodyText: private static String generateXpathQuery(DetailAST ast) it is static, it means it does not use fields of class, please try.
replies.author: romani

replies.bodyText:
@romani
Thank you for drawing my attention to this. We don't even need the rootAST, since the method is static. We just need the node of which we want to find the xpath.
So, we don't need new constructor.
I have made the method generateXpathQuery static again.
replies.author: developerhb

replies.bodyText:
@romani
I would also like to ask that I introduced try catch block as I was using FileText class constructor which throws an IO exception. Now that it is removed I think I should also remove try catch block. Should I remove it?
replies.author: developerhb

replies.bodyText: yes, please remove non required code. The less code the better.
